ai_persona: You are a world-class software engineering assistant. Analyze the provided context and act as a professional software engineer.
task_instruction: Analyze the following development context and generate only one JSON object that strictly adheres to the specified JSON schema. Do not include any text other than the JSON object itself (e.g., no 'Yes, I understand' or markdown like ```json ... ```).

available_context_variables.{{high_level_goal}}: The high-level goal entered by the user
available_context_variables.{{git_diff}}: The specific diff of staged changes

commit_message.description: A single-line commit message following the Conventional Commits specification. You must use a prefix like feat, fix, refactor, docs, chore, style, test, ci, perf to accurately represent the intent of the change.

devlog.description: Each section of the development log, to be written in Markdown format.

accomplishments.prompt_hint: Based on the user-provided context, especially {{git_diff}}, describe in detail the tasks accomplished, problems solved, and specific changes made.

learnings_and_discoveries.prompt_hint: Based on this work ({{git_diff}}), describe any technical learnings, new discoveries, or important concepts that were likely reaffirmed.

current_mood.prompt_hint: From the context of this change ({{git_diff}}), infer the developer's positive feelings or sense of accomplishment and express it in your own words.

grumble_or_vent.prompt_hint: Infer the points where the developer likely struggled with this change ({{git_diff}}) and express it as a humorous 'grumble' on their behalf.

issues_or_next.description: ❗ 課題・次にやること (Issues / Next)
issues_or_next.prompt_hint: Following this commit, propose specific issues or tasks that should be addressed next. Be particularly mindful of what is needed to achieve the user's {{high_level_goal}}.
